016
017package org.tribuo.common.liblinear;
018
019import com.oracle.labs.mlrg.olcut.config.Configurable;
020import com.oracle.labs.mlrg.olcut.provenance.ConfiguredObjectProvenance;
021import com.oracle.labs.mlrg.olcut.provenance.Provenancable;
022import org.tribuo.Output;
023import de.bwaldvogel.liblinear.SolverType;
024
025import java.io.Serializable;
026
027/**
028 * A carrier type for the liblinear algorithm type. It really wants to be a set of enums with
029 * different type parameters, but it's encoded as an interface where each
030 * subclass for an {@link Output} implementation contains an enum with it's
031 * valid values.
032 * <p>
033 * LibLinear supported enum values for various tasks are:
034 * <ul>
035 * <li>L2R_LR - L2-regularized logistic regression (primal)</li>
036 * <li>L2R_L2LOSS_SVC_DUAL - L2-regularized L2-loss support vector classification (dual)</li>
037 * <li>L2R_L2LOSS_SVC - L2-regularized L2-loss support vector classification (primal)</li>
038 * <li>L2R_L1LOSS_SVC_DUAL - L2-regularized L1-loss support vector classification (dual)</li>
039 * <li>MCSVM_CS - multi-class support vector classification by Crammer and Singer</li>
040 * <li>L1R_L2LOSS_SVC - L1-regularized L2-loss support vector classification</li>
041 * <li>L1R_LR - L1-regularized logistic regression</li>
042 * <li>L2R_LR_DUAL - L2-regularized logistic regression (dual)</li>
043 * <li>L2R_L2LOSS_SVR - L2-regularized L2-loss support vector regression (primal)</li>
044 * <li>L2R_L2LOSS_SVR_DUAL - L2-regularized L2-loss support vector regression (dual)</li>
045 * <li>L2R_L1LOSS_SVR_DUAL - L2-regularized L1-loss support vector regression (dual)</li>
046 * </ul>
047 */
048public interface LibLinearType<T extends Output<T>> extends Configurable, Provenancable<ConfiguredObjectProvenance>, Serializable {
049    /*
050    // L2-regularized logistic regression (primal)
051    L2R_LR,
052    // L2-regularized L2-loss support vector classification (dual)
053    L2R_L2LOSS_SVC_DUAL,
054    // L2-regularized L2-loss support vector classification (primal)
055    L2R_L2LOSS_SVC,
056    // L2-regularized L1-loss support vector classification (dual)
057    L2R_L1LOSS_SVC_DUAL,
058    // multi-class support vector classification by Crammer and Singer
059    MCSVM_CS,
060    // L1-regularized L2-loss support vector classification
061    L1R_L2LOSS_SVC,
062    // L1-regularized logistic regression
063    L1R_LR,
064    // L2-regularized logistic regression (dual)
065    L2R_LR_DUAL,
066    // L2-regularized L2-loss support vector regression (primal)
067    L2R_L2LOSS_SVR,
068    // L2-regularized L2-loss support vector regression (dual)
069    L2R_L2LOSS_SVR_DUAL,
070    // L2-regularized L1-loss support vector regression (dual)
071    L2R_L1LOSS_SVR_DUAL;
072    */
073
074    /**
075     * Is this class a Classification algorithm?
076     * @return True if it's a classification algorithm.
077     */
078    public boolean isClassification();
079
080    /**
081     * Is this class a Regression algorithm?
082     * @return True if it's a regression algorithm.
083     */
084    public boolean isRegression();
085
086    /**
087     * Returns the liblinear enum type.
088     * @return The liblinear enum type.
089     */
090    public SolverType getSolverType();
091}
